classifications.description: Dispersions, emulsions, suspoemulsions, suspension concentrates or gels

Biocides, pest repellants or attractants, or plant growth regulators, characterised by their forms, or by their non-active ingredients or by their methods of application, e.g. seed treatment or sequential application; Substances for reducing the noxious effect of the active ingredients to organisms other than pests characterised by the surfactants

Biocides, pest repellants or attractants, or plant growth regulators containing organic compounds containing a carbon atom not being member of a ring and having no bond to a carbon or hydrogen atom, e.g. derivatives of carbonic acid the carbon atom having a double or triple bond to nitrogen, e.g. cyanates, cyanamides
Drugs for skeletal disorders for non-specific disorders of the connective tissue

abstract: This invention relates to new oil-based suspension concentrates containing at least one agrochemical active compound which is solid at room temperature, at least one penetration promoter, at least one vegetable oil, one or more non-ionic surfactants or dispersing aids and/or one or more anionic surfactants or dispersing aids, and optionally one or more additives selected from the group consisting of emulsifying agents, antifoam agents, preservatives, antioxidants, colorants and/or inert filling materials, to a process for the preparation of these suspension concentrates and to their use for the application of the active compounds contained therein.
claims:
1. An oil-based suspension concentrate comprising 
(1) at least one agrochemical active compound that is solid at room temperature,  (2) at least one penetration promoter,  (3) at least one vegetable oil,  (4) one or more non-ionic surfactants or dispersing aids and/or one or more anionic surfactants or dispersing aids, and  (5) optionally, one or more additives selected from the group consisting of emulsifying agents, antifoam agents, preservatives, antioxidants, colorants, inert filling materials, and combinations thereof.

2. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the agrochemical active compound is a fungicide, bactericide, insecticide, acaricide, nematicide, molluscicide, herbicide, plant growth regulator, plant nutrient, a repellent, or a combination thereof.
3. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the agrochemical active compound is thiacloprid.
4. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the agrochemical active compounds are thiacloprid and β-cyfluthrin.

5. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the penetration promoter is one or more alkanol alkoxylates of formula (I) 
     R—O-(-AO)mH   (I) 
    in which 
R represents a straight-chain or branched alkyl having 4 to 20 carbon atoms, 
AO represents an ethylene oxide radical, a propylene oxide radical, a butylene oxide radical, or a mixture of ethylene oxide and propylene oxide radicals or butylene oxide radicals, and 
m represents numbers from 2 to 30.

6. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the penetration promoter is a 2-ethyl-hexyl alkoxylate of formula (Ib-1) 
    
      
        
        
           
           
        
      
    
    in which 
EO represents —CH2—CH2—O—, 
PO represents 
          
and 
the numbers 5 and 3 are average values.

7. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the penetration promoter is a 2-ethyl-hexyl alkoxylate of formula (Ic-1) 
    
      
        
        
           
           
        
      
    
    in which 
EO represents —CH2—CH2—O—, 
PO represents 
          
and 
the numbers 8 and 6 are average values.

8. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein the vegetable oil is sunflower oil, rapeseed oil, olive oil, castor oil, colza oil, maize germ oil, cottonseed oil, soya bean oil, or a combination thereof.

9. A suspension concentrate according to claim 1 wherein 
(a) the content of agrochemical active compounds is between 5 and 30 % by weight,  (b) the content of penetration promoter is between 5 and 55% by weight,  (c) the content of vegetable oil is between 15 and 55% by weight,  (d) the content of surfactants or dispersing aids is between 2.5 and 30 % by weight, and  (e) the content of additives is between 0 and 25% by weight.

10. A process for the preparation of a suspension concentrate according to claim 1 comprising 
(1) mixing 
(a) at least one agrochemical active compound that is solid at room temperature, 
(b) at least one penetration promoter, 
(c) at least one vegetable oil, 
(d) one or more non-ionic surfactants or dispersing aids and/or one or more anionic surfactants or dispersing aids, 
(e) optionally, one or more additives selected from the group consisting of emulsifying agents, antifoam agents, preservatives, antioxidants, colorants, inert filling materials, and combinations thereof, and 
 (2) optionally grinding the resulting suspension.
11. A method of applying agrochemical active compounds to plants and/or their habitat comprising applying a suspension concentrate according to claim 1 to one or more plants and/or their habitat.
